subject: Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: I think always is spelled Awe Low half-letter-Way Utter Zoo on the following grounds: It is listed in the section fully spelt not standard contraction
messageBody:
I think "always" is spelled
Awe Low half-letter-Way Utter Zoo
on the following grounds:

It is listed in the section "fully spelt" not "standard contraction"
and all phonetics that I can find for that word show some sort of
vowel between W and Z. So I'm thinking that 1. Read took that
vowel to be unstressed and indefinite and so used Utter or 2. it is
some undescribed application of his rule for -es endings.

Likewise I think it is not Way + Zoo because he mentions one should
avoid connecting letters when the connection forms an angle more the
90degrees and less than 180. But Way + Zoo forms a 135 degree angle
hence I don't think he would connect them.


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> Paul Tremblay wrote:
>
> >
> > Thanks! I've included these words in a new dictionary and the news
> > should now have these abbreviations. Is there any way you could
include
> > the words that are supposedly already in the CMU? In fact, some of
these
> > words are in my personal dictionary. Both this dictionary, and the
CMU,
> > will undergo change, so I would like to have a separate file that
I can
> > rely on for the standard QS abbreviations and other standard words.
> >
>
> I went ahead and added the standard words to my list. I could make most
> of them out. The only one I had trouble with is "always." The manual
> seems to spell it without a final "Ado," but you have a final
> "Ado"--which is it?
>
> Paul
